issue.title: SIO UART mode
issue.body:
Hi!
Looking at the source for [SIO emulation](https://github.com/mgba-emu/mgba/blob/master/src/gba/sio.c), I don't see any reference to UART mode. Am I missing something or is this not implemented?

I was thinking about running mGBA headless to do automated benchmarking of some homebrew code, and it would be very convenient to dump the measured cycle counts through SIO registers to the emulator's standard output.

issue.title: Emulator crashing when trying to save and load state
issue.body:
Every time I save or load a file in this emulator, the whole thing crashes, not my pc fortunately, but the emulator closes suddenly, ironically enough, the file does get saved, is just that the game closes after doing that.

[Report file.zip](https://github.com/mgba-emu/mgba/files/13186081/Report.file.zip)

issue.title: Trading in Pokémon Red/Blue not working
issue.body: So I am trying to trade between red and blue with mGBA so I open up a new multiplayer window and have both red and blue at a trade spot the first one that presses A on it works and recognises it as being connected to another game bot and will open the link but the second one that presses A acts like nothing is connected and the second one gets a bit glitchy but that’s not important and it also doesn’t matter which one I use I can start the trade on Pokémon red and have it not register on Pokémon blue and then start the trade on Pokémon blue and have it not register on Pokémon red without even resetting

issue.title: [Feature Request] Include 7z/zip archives in Library

labels.name: pending
labels.description: This issue needs more investigation by a maintainer to triage appropriately

issue.body: I prefer to start games through the library, but also prefer to keep all my ROMs in 7z archives. Adding a folder to the library containing 7z archives doesn't add anything to the library. I think it'd be a useful feature to be able to add archives to the library to be able to launch them from the library rather than having to go to File>Open and navigating to the archive location.

comment.body: Isn't this supposed to be closed already?

issue.title: Fails to build with USE_DEBUGGERS=off

labels.name: port:Qt
labels.description: Affects the Qt version (the standard desktop version)

issue.body: In `src/platform/qt/MemoryAccessLogView.cpp` the `attachDebuggerModule` are blocked behind this define, but aren't in this file so fails to build. Adding ifdefs ends up resulting in lots of undefined references during linking (ex. mDebuggerAccessLoggerCreateShadowFile)

issue.title: [Feature request] Some QoL 4 VITA port
issue.body:
### Some simple things with QoL (Quality of Life) changes (more pleasant experience in VITA port):

1. Allow to remap **MENU button** ([Triangle] right now), now it's not possible. Depending on the game, I would prefer to leave [Square] and [Triangle] as:
    - L + R
    - Both Unmapped
    - A + B (repeated)
2. Allow in **MENU** or **Game Selection** to Jump between _first>last_ or _last>first_ item, helps a lot faster navigation in Game Selection or Menu.
3. **Back** & **Cancel** (mapped buttons): seems 2 do the same, should not be just one of them?
4. Have **savegames** & **saves states** in another folder/path/dir (not the same as the ROM game) or maybe a subfolder. Because ROM/game folder becomes a lot cluttered with sav/ss0/ss1 files, I know it's not shown/filtered in the Game Selection.

---

### Bonus: not so easy: Fix _Audio Stuttering_ in most games

- This distract a lot, specially when playing with headphones.
- I know it's not the same, but gPSP Vita retroarch core, manage this a lot better.
- Sometimes overclock from 444 to 500 Mhz (not always) help a little, still it's noticeable
- Maybe it's not possible to be so accurate and needs some optimization that can help.

_Example (no 3D):_
  - **Metroid - Zero Mission**. Easy to notice in between transitions like:
    - **In-Game** <=> **Menu**.
    - Crossing **gates/doors** to next screen.

comment.body:
This project is maintained mainly by one person, and I've been very busy for the past 2 months.

Also you can remap the menu button, it's just called cancel (which is admittedly a poor name).

Savegames and stuff can be put in other folders, but there's no UI for it yet. You have to edit the config file manually.

issue.body:
### Some simple things with QoL (Quality of Life) changes (more pleasant experience in VITA port):

1. Allow to remap **MENU button** ([Triangle] right now), now it's not possible. Depending on the game, I would prefer to leave [Square] and [Triangle] as:
    - L + R
    - Both Unmapped
    - A + B (repeated)
2. Allow in **MENU** or **Game Selection** to Jump between _first>last_ or _last>first_ item, helps a lot faster navigation in Game Selection or Menu.
3. **Back** & **Cancel** (mapped buttons): seems 2 do the same, should not be just one of them?
4. Have **savegames** & **saves states** in another folder/path/dir (not the same as the ROM game) or maybe a subfolder. Because ROM/game folder becomes a lot cluttered with sav/ss0/ss1 files, I know it's not shown/filtered in the Game Selection.

---

### Bonus: not so easy: Fix _Audio Stuttering_ in most games

- This distract a lot, specially when playing with headphones.
- I know it's not the same, but gPSP Vita retroarch core, manage this a lot better.
- Sometimes overclock from 444 to 500 Mhz (not always) help a little, still it's noticeable
- Maybe it's not possible to be so accurate and needs some optimization that can help.

_Example (no 3D):_
  - **Metroid - Zero Mission**. Easy to notice in between transitions like:
    - **In-Game** <=> **Menu**.
    - Crossing **gates/doors** to next screen.

issue.title: [Scripting] Crash when reading memory inside a watchpoint callback
issue.body:
Discord user "Karathan" caused a crash in mGBA with the following code:

```lua
logBuffer = console:createBuffer("Log")

function watchTest()
    logBuffer:clear()
    local value = emu:read8(0x0203FFFC)
    logBuffer:print(string.format("value: %i\n", value))
    logBuffer:print("watchpoint hit!\n")
    
end

function initBus()
    console:log("[MGBA-BUS] init")
    emu:setWatchpoint(watchTest, 0x0203FFFC, C.WATCHPOINT_TYPE.WRITE)
    console:log("[MGBA-BUS] Watching Memory...")
end

callbacks:add("start", initBus)

if emu then
    initBus()
end
```

Relevant chat quotes:

> <@endrift> I should make sure the callbacks only happen during the inter-instruction event instead

> <@ahigerd> Um... blink Hey, um, @endrift, what happens if you read from a read watchpoint callback? Does it trigger the watchpoint again? Or is that protected against? 
> <@endrift> I knew I forgot to test some edge cases

comment.body:
Some information on this:

* I could not reproduce the actual mgba crash, but the script does not work correctly either, the read call crashes the Lua handler
* mgba was built using the w64 docker container

issue.title: [Scripting] Crash when reading memory inside a watchpoint callback
issue.body:
Discord user "Karathan" caused a crash in mGBA with the following code:

```lua
logBuffer = console:createBuffer("Log")

function watchTest()
    logBuffer:clear()
    local value = emu:read8(0x0203FFFC)
    logBuffer:print(string.format("value: %i\n", value))
    logBuffer:print("watchpoint hit!\n")
    
end

function initBus()
    console:log("[MGBA-BUS] init")
    emu:setWatchpoint(watchTest, 0x0203FFFC, C.WATCHPOINT_TYPE.WRITE)
    console:log("[MGBA-BUS] Watching Memory...")
end

callbacks:add("start", initBus)

if emu then
    initBus()
end
```

Relevant chat quotes:

> <@endrift> I should make sure the callbacks only happen during the inter-instruction event instead

> <@ahigerd> Um... blink Hey, um, @endrift, what happens if you read from a read watchpoint callback? Does it trigger the watchpoint again? Or is that protected against?

issue.title: Fails to build with USE_DEBUGGERS=off
issue.body: In `src/platform/qt/MemoryAccessLogView.cpp` the `attachDebuggerModule` are blocked behind this define, but aren't in this file so fails to build. Adding ifdefs ends up resulting in lots of undefined references during linking (ex. mDebuggerAccessLoggerCreateShadowFile)

issue.title: Python support for scripting
issue.body: I read somewhere that it's planned to add Python support for the scripting API, and I think that would be a great idea, unlocking GBA games to easily interface with the most popular ML/RL libraries. I'm willing to help implement this, but I'd need some pointers on where to get started and what needs to be implemented. Any hints?

issue.title: Sound crackling in various games
issue.body:
[issues.zip](https://github.com/mgba-emu/mgba/files/12842090/issues.zip)
After playing a select handful of games, I noticed that after a while a faint but noticeable cracking and fizzling sound starts happening. I have tried messing with a lot of settings but none seemed to do the trick, only causing other issues until I changed them back. I generated the report with The Simpson's Road Rage, but have also noticed it with Sonic Advance 2 and Super Mario Advance. Any help would be appreciated. This is my first time submitting a bug like this so I hope I uploaded the info file correctly. Thanks!

comment.body: I already have the audio sync checked and FPS target set to native, I will try upping the audio buffer next time it occurs. Thank You!
